name: Shipping Industry News Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to keep people informed about developments and activities in the shipping industry.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I only need the system to cover information related to the shipping industry and not other industries.
I expect the system to focus on high-level public information rather than internal operational data from shipping companies.
I want to identify news, companies, and events based on their categorization within the shipping industry rather than by free-form tags alone.
I expect administrators to be able to identify which page areas are available for advertisement placement when managing ad spaces.
I expect news content to be limited to developments that are directly relevant to shipping industry stakeholders.
I want company information to include enough details for users to distinguish companies from one another, such as name, sector, and basic profile.
I want events to be limited to shipping-related conferences, exhibitions, and industry activities rather than general public events.
I expect the newsletter subscription to be related to the same news and updates that appear on the website, not unrelated marketing material.
I want to be able to access news, company information, and events without having to register or log in.
I expect subscribing to newsletters to involve a simple user action such as providing an email address and confirming the subscription.
I expect administrators to manage ad spaces through a dedicated backend interface rather than editing the website layout directly in code.
I want users to navigate to each type of information (news, company profiles, events) via clear entry points on the website.
I expect the news, company profiles, and events to be separated into distinct sections rather than being mixed in a single undifferentiated list.
I want the old lace background color to be consistently applied across all main pages of the website.
I expect rosy brown styling to be applied consistently to key interface components such as headers, buttons, or navigation elements.
I want the visual design to prioritize readability of text over decorative elements, even when using the old lace background and rosy brown components.
I expect advertisements to be visually distinguishable from editorial content so that users can clearly see what is ads versus news or information.
I only need a web-based solution rather than a mobile app or other distribution channel for this information.
I want the content in each section (news, companies, events) to be oriented toward helping users stay informed rather than providing transactional services.
I expect users to consume information primarily by browsing through sections rather than relying on advanced search or filtering mechanisms.

URL: As a user, I want to browse shipping industry news so that I can stay informed about the latest developments.
As a user, I want to browse company information so that I can learn about different companies in the shipping industry.
As a user, I want to browse events so that I can keep track of upcoming shipping industry activities.
As a user, I want to subscribe to newsletters so that I can receive updates from the news blog website.
As a user, I want to view a dedicated news section so that I can easily find all shipping news articles.
As a user, I want to view a company profiles section so that I can access detailed information about shipping companies.
As a user, I want to view an events section so that I can see all listed shipping industry events.
As an administrator, I want to manage ad spaces in the backend management system so that I can control the advertisements displayed on the website.
As a user, I want the website to use an old lace background so that the visual styling matches the intended design.
As a user, I want components styled in rosy brown so that the interface has a consistent look and feel.
instruction: Please implement a news blog website for the shipping industry to publish news and company information. The website should have sections for news, company profiles, and events. Users should be able to browse news, company information, and events, and subscribe to newsletters. The website should have a backend management system that allows administrators to manage ad spaces. Implement styling with old lace for the background and rosy brown for components.

name: Agriculture Info Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me easily access and understand various agricultural information online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify agricultural news of interest primarily by topic keywords such as crop type, region, or issue rather than by technical codes or IDs.
I expect to specify which farm products I want to learn about by selecting from human-readable categories like grains, fruits, vegetables, and livestock.
I expect to identify my local weather by providing a location such as a city name, postal code, or selecting a region on a map.
I expect to enter search queries in a free-text search box using natural language or simple keywords.
I expect the agricultural news content to be limited to agriculture-related topics rather than general world news.
I expect farm product information to cover a broad range of commonly cultivated products instead of focusing on a single crop or region.
I expect weather forecasts to be focused on short- to medium-term conditions that are practically useful for agricultural planning.
I expect search and filter functions to operate only within agricultural-related content provided by the system rather than the entire web.
I expect agricultural news items to include essential details such as title, publication date, source, and a brief summary.
I expect farm product information to include basic attributes like typical uses, cultivation characteristics, and key distinguishing features.
I expect weather information to include temperature, precipitation, and other conditions that directly affect farming activities.
I expect search results to show enough context, such as a short snippet or description, to judge whether an item is relevant before opening it.
I expect to browse agricultural news through clickable lists or cards that let me open a full article view when needed.
I expect to move between different types of farm product information using simple navigation controls like tabs or category menus.
I expect the local weather information to update automatically when I change my selected location.
I expect search and filter controls to be easily accessible on the same pages where the corresponding results are displayed.
I expect filters to be adjustable and removable without having to restart the search from scratch.
I expect the light cyan background to be applied consistently across all main pages so that the site looks unified.
I expect cadet blue to be used for key interface elements such as headers, buttons, and navigation components to maintain a coherent color scheme.
I expect text and content to remain clearly readable against the light cyan background and cadet blue elements.
I expect agricultural information lists, such as news or products, to be presented in a clean, uncluttered layout that matches the chosen color theme.

URL: As a user, I want to browse agricultural-related news so that I can stay informed about agriculture.
As a user, I want to view different types of farm product information so that I can learn about various farm products.
As a user, I want to check local weather forecasts so that I can understand weather conditions relevant to agriculture.
As a user, I want to perform searches so that I can quickly find specific agricultural information I am interested in.
As a user, I want to use filters so that I can narrow down agricultural information based on my preferences.
As a user, I want the website to use a light cyan background so that the visual theme is consistent with the specified design.
As a user, I want the website elements to use cadet blue so that the interface follows the required color scheme.
instruction: Please implement an agriculture-related website for displaying and managing agricultural information. The website should have functionalities for browsing agricultural news, viewing farm product information, and checking weather forecasts. Users should be able to browse agricultural-related news, view different types of farm product information, check local weather forecasts, and perform searches and filters. Apply theme using light cyan as background and cadet blue for elements.

name: Real-Time Culinary Guide
initial_requirements: I need an application that helps me discover and explore food options and cooking ideas in real time.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the application to determine my current location automatically so that nearby restaurants can be identified without manual address entry.
I want to be able to enter keywords such as cuisine type, dish name, or restaurant name when searching for recipes or restaurants.
I assume I can refine my search using simple filters like cuisine, price range, or dietary tags rather than only using free-text search.
I want the application to cover both eating out at restaurants and cooking at home so that I can switch between these two options within the same app.
I expect the restaurant information to be limited to places that are currently operating and realistically reachable from my location.
I assume recipe suggestions will focus on typical home-cooking dishes rather than professional or industrial-scale recipes.
I want restaurant entries to include basic details such as name, address, and type of cuisine so that browsing is meaningful.
I expect recipe entries to include at least the dish name, a short description, and a list of ingredients.
I want reviews to include written comments in addition to ratings so that I can understand the context behind users' scores.
I assume ratings will be aggregated into an overall score for each restaurant or recipe so that I can see a summary judgment at a glance.
I expect reviews and ratings to indicate when they were created so that I can judge how recent the feedback is.
I want restaurant and recipe listings to show their average rating alongside the title so that quality information is visible without extra clicks.
I assume I will need to be signed in or otherwise identified to submit my own reviews and ratings.
I want to be able to navigate between restaurant browsing, recipe searching, and review viewing without having to restart my session or lose context.
I expect adding a review or rating to be done through a simple form directly from the restaurant or recipe detail view.
I want the search and browse functions to respond quickly enough that exploring options feels like a real-time experience.
I expect restaurant and recipe results to be displayed in a list or grid that I can scroll through easily.
I want reviews to be shown in a readable, vertically stacked format where each user’s contribution is clearly separated.
I assume the lemon chiffon background color will be applied consistently across main screens of the application.
I expect the chocolate component styles to apply to primary interface elements such as buttons, headers, or cards so that the design appears coherent.

URL: As a user, I want to browse restaurants so that I can discover dining options.
As a user, I want to search for recipes so that I can find specific dishes I am interested in.
As a user, I want to view reviews so that I can understand other users' experiences.
As a user, I want to view ratings so that I can quickly gauge the quality of restaurants or recipes.
As a user, I want to browse nearby restaurants so that I can find convenient places to eat close to my location.
As a user, I want to search for specific recipes so that I can quickly locate particular meals I want to cook.
As a user, I want to view other users' reviews and ratings so that I can make informed decisions about where to eat or what to cook.
As a user, I want to add my own reviews so that I can share my experience with others.
As a user, I want to add my own ratings so that I can contribute my evaluation of restaurants or recipes.
As a user, I want the application background colored in lemon chiffon so that the interface has the specified appearance.
As a user, I want the component styles set to chocolate so that the visual elements match the desired design.
instruction: Please implement a real-time culinary guide application to display restaurant and recipe information. The application should have functionalities for browsing restaurants, searching recipes, viewing reviews and ratings, and more. Users should be able to browse nearby restaurants, search for specific recipes, view other users' reviews and ratings, and add their own reviews and ratings. Color the background using lemon chiffon and set component styles to chocolate.

name: Family Memorial Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to help my family share, preserve, and reflect on loved ones’ memorial information and memories.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each obituary will be associated with a specific deceased person identified at least by their name and date of death.
I expect funeral arrangements to be linked to a specific obituary or deceased person so that details are not entered in isolation.
I expect to identify funeral arrangements by key details such as date, time, and location to distinguish one event from another.
I assume that my family members and close friends will be the main users of this system rather than the general public.
I expect the system to cover multiple obituaries and funeral arrangements over time for different loved ones instead of just a single event.
I assume that the system will allow viewing obituaries and funeral arrangements from different branches of the family, not only my immediate household.
I expect each obituary to include basic biographical details such as birth and death dates and a short life summary.
I want funeral arrangements to include practical information such as venue address, service schedule, and any reception details.
I expect condolence messages to consist primarily of text, possibly including short memories or sympathy notes.
I assume that mortuary entries will at least show the mortuary name and contact details relevant to the associated funeral.
I expect the statistical analysis to summarize counts or trends over time related to obituaries and funeral arrangements rather than raw data only.
I expect the system to preserve previously entered obituary and funeral information even after the funeral has taken place.
I assume I will have some form of personal account or identity in the system that distinguishes my actions from those of other users.
I expect that only the user who created an obituary or funeral arrangement, or an equivalent owner, can manage and update it.
I assume that leaving a condolence message does not require me to edit the obituary itself but is a separate action attached to it.
I expect to be able to access obituaries, funeral arrangements, mortuary lists, and statistics through simple navigation within the same portal.
I expect that when I update obituary or funeral information, the updated information becomes visible to other users without them needing to republish anything.
I assume that obituary and funeral information, once published, can be revisited multiple times by different users without needing to re-enter it.
I expect the cornsilk outer layout color to be consistently applied across all pages of the portal.
I expect peru-colored UI blocks to be visually distinct elements such as cards, panels, or sections within the cornsilk background.
I assume that condolence messages will be displayed in an easily scannable list under the corresponding obituary.
I expect statistical analysis results to be shown in a human-readable form such as tables or simple charts rather than just raw numbers.
I expect the mortuary list to be presented in a structured format, such as a list or table, where each mortuary is clearly separated.
I assume the overall visual style of the site will remain subdued and respectful in tone, matching the memorial context.

URL: As a user, I want to publish my own obituaries so that I can share information about a loved one’s passing.
As a user, I want to manage my own obituaries so that I can update or correct the published information.
As a user, I want to publish funeral arrangements so that I can inform others about the details of the funeral.
As a user, I want to manage my published funeral arrangements so that I can modify them if plans change.
As a user, I want to view obituaries published by others so that I can stay informed about family events and losses.
As a user, I want to leave messages of condolence on others’ obituaries so that I can express my sympathy and support.
As a user, I want to view messages of condolence on obituaries so that I can see the support and memories shared by others.
As a user, I want to view a mortuary list so that I can see information related to mortuaries involved in the arrangements.
As a user, I want to view statistical analysis related to obituaries and funeral arrangements so that I can understand trends and insights.
As a user, I want the website layout to use cornsilk for the outer layout so that the portal has a consistent visual theme.
As a user, I want UI blocks to use peru as their color so that the interface elements are visually distinct within the layout.
instruction: Please implement a family event portal website for publishing and storing obituaries, funeral arrangements, and multimedia memories. The website should have functionalities for obituary publishing, mortuary list, condolences, and statistics. Users should be able to publish and manage their own obituaries and funeral arrangements, view and leave messages on others' obituaries, and view statistical analysis. Use cornsilk for the outer layout and peru for UI blocks.

name: Environmental Warning System
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me monitor current environmental conditions and changes over time.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that "environmental conditions" in this system are limited to weather and air-quality-related parameters rather than a broader set of environmental factors.
I expect the system to focus on near-term historical data, with two weeks of past information being sufficient for understanding recent changes over time.
I expect the system to cover all days within the two-week AQI history without gaps so that I can follow the continuity of air-quality changes.
I expect the system to automatically determine which location’s environmental data to show by default, without requiring me to manually enter complex parameters each time.
I assume that weather data, air quality data, and gas sensor data are all associated with the same geographic area or monitoring site unless I explicitly choose otherwise.
I expect the air quality information to be expressed in a standardized index format (AQI) rather than only raw pollutant concentration values.
I want the gas sensor data to include distinct readings for different gas types instead of a single aggregated pollution value.
I expect real-time weather data to at least include temperature and humidity alongside any other available parameters.
I expect the comparison of pollution and air quality changes to use a consistent time basis so that values from different moments can be meaningfully related.
I want all environmental data (weather, air quality, and gas sensor readings) to refresh automatically without requiring manual page reloads.
I prefer to access real-time and historical environmental information through a web interface rather than installing a separate application.
I expect navigating between current data views and historical comparison views to be possible within the same website without switching to external tools.
I expect to be able to switch quickly between different types of environmental data (weather, AQI, gas sensors) without losing my place in the interface.
I want the real-time and historical environmental data to be presented in a visually coherent way so that different data types can be understood together at a glance.
I assume that the chosen colors (azure mist background and dark slate blue elements) will provide sufficient contrast to keep text and data easily readable.
I want the same azure mist background color to be applied consistently across all pages of the website to maintain a unified look.
I expect primary interactive elements such as navigation, buttons, and key data highlights to use dark slate blue so that important controls and information stand out.
I expect both current and historical environmental data to be displayed in a clear, structured layout rather than in raw or unformatted form.

URL: As a user, I want to view real-time weather data so that I can understand current environmental conditions.
As a user, I want to view real-time air quality data so that I can monitor current pollution levels.
As a user, I want the website to have a real-time update function so that the displayed environmental data is always up to date.
As a user, I want to view the air quality index (AQI) for the past two weeks so that I can understand how air quality has changed over time.
As a user, I want to compare pollution and air quality changes so that I can observe trends and fluctuations.
As a user, I want to browse current temperature data so that I can know how hot or cold it is now.
As a user, I want to browse current humidity data so that I can understand the moisture level in the air.
As a user, I want to browse current gas sensor data so that I can see detailed information about detected gases.
As a user, I want the primary background of the website to be azure mist so that the interface has a consistent visual style.
As a user, I want the website elements to use dark slate blue so that the design is visually coherent and readable.
instruction: Please implement an environmental warning system website to display real-time weather and air quality data. The website should have a real-time update function, displaying the air quality index (AQI) for the past two weeks, and allowing users to compare pollution and air quality changes. Users should be able to browse current weather and air quality data, including temperature, humidity, and gas sensor data. Set primary background to azure mist and elements to dark slate blue.

name: Healthy Living Blog
initial_requirements: I need a website that helps people access and share information about healthy living.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify relevant articles primarily by textual attributes such as title, summary, and body text rather than by images or multimedia alone.
I expect to specify my interests in health topics using predefined topic labels rather than entering free-form tags for following content.
I expect the website to host multiple articles across a variety of healthy living themes, not just a small fixed set of pages.
I assume that both general users seeking information and contributors publishing health content will use the same website interface rather than separate systems.
I expect that comments will be associated only with individual articles and not with other types of pages on the website.
I expect articles to contain enough textual detail that browsing them meaningfully supports learning about healthy lifestyles.
I expect topic categories to reflect distinct aspects of healthy living, such as nutrition, exercise, or mental health, rather than arbitrary or purely technical groupings.
I expect search results to include both article titles and short summaries so that I can judge relevance before opening an article.
I expect user comments to be displayed alongside basic metadata such as who posted them and when they were posted.
I expect browsing articles to involve navigating lists or grids of articles that I can click to open full content pages.
I expect to interact with search through a standard search box where I can type keywords and submit a query.
I expect to be able to click on topic names or category labels to see all articles belonging to that topic.
I expect posting a comment to be done via a text input area located directly below the article content.
I expect following a topic to be triggered by a simple control such as a button or toggle on the topic or article view.
I assume that publishing an article will be done through a form-based interface where I can input title, body, and select categories.
I expect health-related articles to be presented in a clean, readable layout with clear separation between title, content, and comments.
I expect topic categories and follow options to be visually prominent enough that I can easily recognize and use them while viewing articles.
I assume that the misty rose global background will apply consistently across all main pages, including article lists, article details, and search results.
I assume that using firebrick for all components means that navigation elements, buttons, and interactive controls share a consistent firebrick-based styling.
I expect the firebrick component color to provide sufficient visual contrast against the misty rose background so that interface elements are clearly distinguishable.

URL: As a user, I want to browse health-related articles so that I can learn about promoting healthy lifestyles.
As a user, I want to search articles so that I can quickly find specific health information I am interested in.
As a user, I want to view articles categorized by topics so that I can easily navigate different health themes.
As a user, I want to post comments on articles so that I can share my thoughts and engage in discussions.
As a user, I want to follow specific topics so that I can keep up with articles related to my interests.
As a user, I want the website to provide functionalities for publishing articles so that health-related content can be shared.
As a user, I want the website to support commenting functionality so that discussions can take place under articles.
As a user, I want the website to support searching functionality so that content can be easily discovered.
As a user, I want the website to support categorizing functionality so that articles are organized by category.
As a user, I want the website to use misty rose for the global background so that the overall look is consistent with the design choice.
As a user, I want the website to use firebrick for all components so that the interface has a unified component color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a health blog website for publishing health-related articles and promoting healthy lifestyles. The website should have functionalities for publishing articles, commenting, searching, and categorizing. Users should be able to browse and search articles, post comments, and follow specific topics. Choose misty rose for global background and firebrick for all components.

name: Poetry Sharing Blog
initial_requirements: I need a website where people can read, share, and discuss poetry.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify poetry primarily by its title and author when browsing or searching.
I assume I can specify what I am looking for using text-based keywords when searching for poetry.
I expect poetry categories or types to be presented as selectable labels or filters rather than requiring me to type them manually.
I expect the website to host multiple poems from many different users, not just a small curated set.
I assume that all publicly posted poems will be available to all visitors for browsing.
I expect that when I browse different types of poetry, I will see more than just a few predefined categories.
I expect each poem to show at least its title, author, and full text when I view it.
I want comments to be associated directly with individual poems so they appear in context beneath the poem.
I assume that when I post my poetry, it will be shown together with other poems in browsing and search results.
I want poetry categories to be meaningful literary groupings such as style, form, or theme rather than arbitrary labels.
I expect browsing poetry to involve simple navigation actions like clicking on poem titles or cards to open them.
I assume I will be able to initiate a search through a clearly visible search field or icon on the website.
I expect posting my own poetry to be done through a dedicated form or page where I can enter and submit my poem.
I expect commenting on poetry to be done via a text input area attached to each poem with a clear action to submit the comment.
I assume that browsing by poetry type will allow me to change or refine the visible list of poems without needing to leave the main browsing area.
I expect the light goldenrod layout color to be used as the dominant background or primary surface color of pages.
I expect olive drab to be consistently applied to all primary interactive elements such as buttons and poetry preview cards.
I assume that the poetry text will be visually distinguished from surrounding interface elements so that reading is comfortable and unobstructed.
I expect categories or types of poetry to be visually separated or grouped in a way that makes it easy to distinguish between them.

URL: As a user, I want to browse poetry so that I can view various poetry content on the website.
As a user, I want to search for poetry so that I can quickly find specific poetry I am interested in.
As a user, I want to post my own poetry so that I can share my work on the poetry blog website.
As a user, I want to comment on others' poetry so that I can share my thoughts and feedback.
As a user, I want to browse different types of poetry so that I can explore various poetry categories.
As a user, I want the website layout to use light goldenrod so that I experience the intended visual style.
As a user, I want buttons and cards to use olive drab so that the interactive elements have a consistent design.
instruction: Please implement a poetry blog website for displaying and sharing poetry content. The website should have functionalities for browsing poetry, searching poetry, posting poetry, and commenting on poetry. Users should be able to browse different types of poetry, search for specific poetry, post their own poetry, and comment on others' poetry. Apply light goldenrod for layout; use olive drab for buttons and cards.

name: Designer Portfolio Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a website to present my design work and professional profile to potential clients or collaborators.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want the website to focus exclusively on my design work and professional profile, without including unrelated personal content.
I want each design work in my portfolio to be identifiable as an individual item that users can select or view separately.
I want each portfolio item to include at least a title and a visual representation of the work, such as an image or mockup.
I want my background and experience to be presented as structured profile information, such as education, skills, and work history.
I want my contact section to include at least one direct communication channel, such as an email address.
I want my contact information to be clearly separated from my portfolio and profile content so users can recognize it easily.
I want users to be able to navigate between the portfolio, profile, and contact sections without needing to reload or leave the main website.
I want users to be able to quickly locate my contact information from any main section of the site.
I want my design works to be displayed in a visually organized layout rather than as a plain text list.
I want my professional profile content to be presented in a readable format that distinguishes headings from body text.
I want peach puff to be applied consistently as the primary background color across the site’s pages.
I want indian red to be used consistently for interactive components such as buttons, links, or key interface elements.
I want the peach puff background and indian red components to be used together in a way that maintains a coherent and intentional visual theme.
I want text and images on the peach puff background and indian red components to remain clearly legible.
I want the website to be a single coherent portfolio site dedicated to my work rather than a multi-designer platform.

URL: As a user, I want to browse the designer's portfolio so that I can view their design works.
As a user, I want to learn about the designer's background and experience so that I can understand their professional profile.
As a user, I want to access the designer's contact information so that I can get in touch with them.
As a user, I want the website to showcase works about the designer so that I can see examples of their design.
As a user, I want the website theme to use peach puff as the background color so that the visual style matches the intended design.
As a user, I want the website components to use indian red as the component color so that the interface elements have a consistent appearance.
instruction: Please implement a personal portfolio website to showcase design works. The website should have functionalities for showcasing works about the designer, and contact information. Users should be able to browse the designer's portfolio, learn about the designer's background and experience, and get in touch with the designer through contact information. Configure your theme with peach puff as background and indian red as component color.

name: Online CV Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a system to present my professional profile and experience online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I consider my CV to be a single, structured document that includes personal information, work experience, skills, education, and personal projects.
I want all main aspects of my professional profile—personal information, work experience, skills, education, and personal projects—to be accessible within the same online system.
I want the online CV to provide enough detail in each section for someone to form a complete picture of my professional profile without needing external documents.
I expect the personal information section to contain only standard basic details relevant to professional evaluation, such as name and contact-related data.
I expect the work experience content to focus on professional roles and responsibilities rather than unrelated personal history.
I expect the skills section to group related competencies together so that my capabilities can be quickly evaluated.
I expect the education background to emphasize formal academic qualifications rather than informal learning activities.
I expect personal projects to be presented in a way that highlights how they demonstrate my skills and experience.
I want users to be able to browse the CV via a website interface rather than downloading a separate file.
I want users to navigate between different sections of my CV without losing the context that they are still viewing my overall professional profile.
I want the CV to be organized into clearly separated sections such as personal information, work experience, skills, education, and personal projects.
I want the entire page background to consistently use a light pink color as the base of the visual design.
I want medium violet red to be consistently used for key UI components such as buttons, highlights, or section headers.
I want the light pink background and medium violet red UI elements to be visually compatible and create a coherent aesthetic.
I want the layout to prioritize readability so that information in each section can be quickly scanned and understood.

URL: As a user, I want to browse the CV so that I can view the comprehensive personal information and work experience.
As a user, I want to view personal information so that I can understand the individual's basic details.
As a user, I want to view work experience so that I can understand the individual's professional background.
As a user, I want to understand the individual's skills so that I can assess their capabilities.
As a user, I want to understand the individual's education background so that I can see their academic qualifications.
As a user, I want to view personal projects so that I can see the individual's showcased work.
As a user, I want the website to use a light pink background so that the overall appearance matches the specified style.
As a user, I want the UI components to apply medium violet red so that the interface follows the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please create a comprehensive CV website to display personal information and work experience. The website should have functionalities for displaying personal information, work experience, skills, education background, and projects. Users should be able to browse the CV, view work experience, understand skills and education background, and showcase personal projects. Use a light pink background and apply medium violet red to the UI components.

name: Personal Link Tree Manager
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me organize and share my collection of web links in one place.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify each link primarily by its URL and an associated title when adding it to my link tree.
I want to specify the order of links in my link tree rather than having them appear only in the order they were created.
I assume I can maintain a single unified link tree that aggregates all the links I want to share at once.
I expect there to be no strict limit on the number of links I can include in my link tree.
I want the shareable link to give access to the entire link tree rather than to individual links only.
I expect each link entry to support at least a URL, a descriptive label or title, and optionally a short description.
I assume I can organize links in a simple vertical list without needing advanced grouping or categorization.
I want the link tree page visible to others to show only the links and basic visual styling, without exposing any editing controls.
I want to be able to create, add, edit, and delete links through a simple form-based interface rather than through complex configuration steps.
I expect changes I make to my link tree to be applied immediately so that the shared view reflects updates without extra publishing steps.
I assume I can copy the shareable link directly from the interface without having to construct it manually.
I want managing my link tree to be possible from a single management screen rather than navigating through multiple separate pages.
I expect the papaya whip background color to apply consistently across all pages where my link tree is viewed or managed.
I want dark orange to be used for key interactive components such as buttons, link containers, or highlights so they stand out against the background.
I assume the link tree layout will be simple and uncluttered so that the papaya whip background and dark orange components remain visually prominent.
I expect the shared link tree page to visually match the management view in terms of background and component colors.

URL: As a user, I want to create my own link tree so that I can organize and display my links in one place.
As a user, I want to add new links to my link tree so that I can include all the relevant links I want to share.
As a user, I want to edit existing links in my link tree so that I can update their information when needed.
As a user, I want to delete unnecessary links from my link tree so that I can keep my link collection clean and relevant.
As a user, I want to manage my link tree so that I can maintain control over how my links are organized and displayed.
As a user, I want to share my link tree with others through a shareable link so that people can easily access all my links in one place.
As a user, I want the overall background of the website to be papaya whip so that the interface has a consistent visual style.
As a user, I want the components styled with dark orange so that the website elements visually stand out against the background.
instruction: Please implement a link tree website for displaying and managing links. The website should have functionalities for adding, editing, and deleting links. Users should be able to create and manage their own link tree, including adding new links, editing existing links, deleting unnecessary links, and sharing their link tree with others through link tree's shareable link. Set overall background to papaya whip, then style components with dark orange.

name: Biography Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a system to help people explore and understand a person's life and achievements.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want the system to focus on biographies of individual persons rather than groups, organizations, or events.
I want each biography to cover the person’s full lifespan or career span rather than focusing on a single period only.
I want to identify a specific biography primarily by the person’s name when I am looking for their life story.
I want the search function to accept simple text queries without requiring advanced filters or complex query syntax.
I want basic information about a person to include details such as their name, birth information, and primary occupation or role.
I want life experiences to include both personal milestones and professional developments that outline the person’s journey.
I want achievements to focus on concrete outcomes or contributions the person is known for, rather than general personality traits.
I want honors to be limited to named awards, titles, or formal recognitions the person has received.
I want related content in search results to include other people with similar backgrounds, fields, or achievements.
I want to be able to move from a list of multiple biographies to a single, detailed biography page for a chosen person.
I want to navigate from high-level overviews of people to more detailed pages with additional information using simple clicks or taps.
I want to be able to repeatedly refine my exploration by alternating between browsing lists of people and opening individual biographies.
I want the search function to be accessible from any page where I am viewing biography information.
I want basic information, life experiences, achievements, and honors to be visually separated into distinguishable sections on the page.
I want the website to consistently use the same background color across all pages so that the experience feels unified.
I want all visible interface elements, including text and controls, to share the same dim gray color to maintain a uniform appearance.
I want the snow background and dim gray elements to be applied in a way that does not distract from reading the biography content.
I want detailed biography pages to expand on the summary information rather than introducing unrelated topics about the person.
I want the system to include multiple biographies so that browsing across different individuals is always possible.
I want to be able to initiate browsing without providing any specific search criteria, for example by starting from a general list of biographies.

URL: As a user, I want to view a biography website that displays a person's life and achievements so that I can learn about their background and accomplishments.
As a user, I want to view basic information about the person so that I can understand their fundamental details.
As a user, I want to view the person's life experiences so that I can understand their personal and professional journey.
As a user, I want to view the person's achievements so that I can recognize their significant accomplishments.
As a user, I want to view the person's honors so that I can see the awards and recognitions they have received.
As a user, I want to browse biographies so that I can explore different individuals' life stories.
As a user, I want to view detailed information in a biography so that I can gain an in-depth understanding of the person.
As a user, I want to search for related content so that I can quickly find biographies or information connected to my interests.
As a user, I want to use a search function on the website so that I can quickly find relevant information.
As a user, I want the website to have a snow background color so that the visual appearance matches the specified design.
As a user, I want all elements on the website to be dim gray so that the interface maintains a consistent color scheme.
instruction: Please create a biography website to display a person's life and achievements. The website should have functionalities to display basic information, life experiences, achievements, and honors. Users should be able to browse biographies, view detailed information, and search for related content. The website should have a search function, allowing users to quickly find relevant information. Assign snow as the background color and apply dim gray to all elements.

name: Team Portfolio Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets people understand my team’s work and capabilities and get in touch with us.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume users will identify the team and its work by accessing a single, dedicated web page or site specifically about my team rather than multiple separate systems.

I want the system to focus only on presenting high-level team information, project cases, skills, and contact details, without additional modules such as blogs, user accounts, or document repositories.
I expect the project cases shown to be a curated subset of representative examples rather than an exhaustive list of every project the team has ever done.
I expect the skills information to be presented at the team level rather than listing detailed skill profiles for individual team members.
I want the team introduction to include a concise overview of what the team does, its mission or focus, and the types of work it undertakes.
I expect each project case to include enough descriptive information, such as a short summary and key outcomes, for users to understand the nature of the work.
I want the skills section to group related capabilities into understandable categories instead of listing them as one long undifferentiated list.
I expect the contact information to include at least one direct digital channel, such as an email address or contact form, rather than only generic organization contacts.

I assume users will access all team, project, skills, and contact information by navigating within a single web page or closely linked pages using standard web interactions like clicking and scrolling.
I want users to be able to move between team introduction, project cases, skills, and contact sections without needing to log in or perform any complex actions.
I want the page to use a consistent base background color of whitesmoke across all sections to give a unified visual impression.
I expect primary components such as cards, sections, or key UI elements to use dark cyan as their main color so that they stand out against the background.
I assume the chosen whitesmoke background and dark cyan component color will be applied uniformly, rather than varying the color scheme significantly between sections.
I want the use of dark cyan for components to serve as a visual identity color associated with my team’s branding on the page.

URL: As a user, I want to browse team information so that I can learn about the team introduction.
As a user, I want to view project cases so that I can see the project showcase.
As a user, I want to understand team skills so that I can assess the skill showcase.
As a user, I want to view the team's contact information so that I can contact the team.
As a user, I want the webpage background color initialized with whitesmoke so that the overall page appearance is consistent.
As a user, I want the component color initialized with dark cyan so that the components have a distinct and cohesive style.
instruction: Please implement a webpage to showcase team projects and skills, including team introduction, project showcase, skill showcase, and contact information. Users should be able to browse team information, view project cases, understand team skills, and contact the team through the contact information. Initialize the background color with whitesmoke and component color with dark cyan.

name: Fitness Tracker Mini Program
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me record my workouts and track my overall fitness progress.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to be able to identify each workout entry by the type of activity, date, and time so I can distinguish between different sessions.
I want to specify key workout details such as duration, distance, sets, reps, or weight when I record an exercise.
I want to associate my fitness diary entries with specific dates so I can relate them to my recorded workouts.
I want my fitness data to be clearly linked to my own user account so it is kept separate from other users’ data.
I want the system to focus primarily on tracking my physical exercise activities rather than covering all possible health aspects such as diet or sleep.
I want the leaderboard to compare my performance against a defined group of users within the same system rather than external platforms.
I want my tracked fitness data to cover an extended time period so that long-term trends and improvements can be observed.
I want the statistics homepage to summarize the most important fitness metrics instead of showing every detailed data point.
I want each workout record to include both the type of exercise and the quantitative performance metrics that matter to me.
I want the exercise history to show essential information such as date, activity type, and performance metrics for each past workout.
I want the leaderboard to use objective performance indicators, such as totals or averages, to rank users.
I want the fitness diary to allow me to capture subjective information like thoughts, feelings, and experiences related to my workouts.
I want the system to store both my raw fitness data and derived statistics, such as summaries or trends over time.
I want the statistics homepage to highlight key indicators of progress, such as total volume, frequency of workouts, or recent changes.
I want to be able to create, update, and delete my own exercise records without needing assistance from others.
I want to browse my past exercises through an interface that lets me navigate by time period, such as days, weeks, or months.
I want to be able to enter fitness diary notes in free-text form so I can write in my own words.
I want to access the leaderboard from within the same system where I track my workouts so I do not have to switch applications.
I want to reach the statistics homepage quickly, ideally as the main entry point when I open the system.
I want my past exercises to be listed in chronological order so I can easily follow the sequence of my workouts.
I want the leaderboard to clearly display my own position relative to others so I can see where I stand at a glance.
I want the fitness diary entries to be shown in a timeline-like view so I can read my journey over time.
I want fitness statistics to be presented in a visual, easy-to-understand format, such as charts or summary tiles.
I want the statistics homepage to use an at-a-glance layout that surfaces the most important information without requiring additional clicks.

URL: As a user, I want to record my fitness activities so that I can manage my fitness progress.
As a user, I want to browse my own exercises so that I can review my past fitness activities.
As a user, I want to record my own exercises so that I can keep an accurate log of my workouts.
As a user, I want to view a fitness leaderboard so that I can see how my performance compares with others.
As a user, I want to write a fitness diary so that I can document my fitness journey and experiences.
As a user, I want to track my own fitness data so that I can monitor changes and improvements over time.
As a user, I want a fitness statistics homepage so that I can see an overview of my fitness data at a glance.
instruction: Please implement a fitness tracking mini-program for users to record and manage their fitness activities. The mini-program should have functionalities such as a fitness leaderboard, exercise recording, fitness diary, and a fitness statistics homepage. Users should be able to browse and record their own exercises, view the leaderboard, write a fitness diary, and track their own fitness data. Apply white to the canvas background and navy to all visible components.

name: Engineer Tool Info Hub
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps engineers easily find and evaluate information about different tools.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that using the website’s core functionality (such as commenting and rating tools) requires having a registered user account.
I prefer that once I am logged in, the website remembers my identity during a visit so I can access my personal features without repeatedly re‑entering my credentials.
I expect to identify tools primarily by their names when searching or browsing.
I expect the catalog to include multiple tools of different types so that searching, filtering, and comparison make sense.
I want each tool entry to present a concise summary of the most important information without requiring me to open the detailed view.
I assume that the tool description will explain the tool in non‑marketing, technically accurate terms suitable for engineers.
I expect the description of each tool’s function to clearly state its primary engineering use cases rather than generic slogans.
I assume that tool prices are shown in a consistent currency so I can compare tools directly.
I expect the system to include pricing information for all tools listed, not just a subset.
I expect the search feature to accept text input such as tool names, keywords, or functions.
I prefer that searching for tools provides results dynamically after I submit my query, rather than requiring multiple navigation steps.
I expect filters to apply across the entire tools catalog rather than being limited to a single small subset of tools.
I expect filter options to correspond to common engineer‑relevant criteria such as price range, tool category, or key capabilities.
I want filtering to work in combination with search so that both criteria can be used together to narrow down tools.
I prefer that applying or clearing filters updates the visible list of tools without requiring me to reload the entire page manually.
I assume the detailed tool view will aggregate all available information about a tool in one place so I do not need to navigate through multiple pages for the same tool.
I expect to access detailed tool information by selecting a specific tool from a list or search result.
I expect commenting on a tool to require that I am logged in so feedback is associated with my account.
I expect comments on tools to be visible to other users so my feedback contributes to their evaluation.
I want to be able to submit a comment in a single step from the tool’s page without going through a separate multi‑page process.
I expect that rating a tool is a separate action from commenting, so I can rate without necessarily writing a comment.
I assume that each user can provide only one rating per tool, which can be updated rather than duplicated.
I expect the system to aggregate individual ratings into an overall score that I can see when evaluating tools.
I expect the ivory background color to be applied consistently across all pages and major sections of the site, not just selected screens.
I expect ivory to be used only as a background and not for primary text, to preserve readability.
I assume forest green will be used consistently for all interactive UI elements such as buttons, links, and controls.
I expect the forest green UI elements to be visually distinct against the ivory background so they are easy to identify.
I prefer that any additional accent colors used in the interface remain compatible with the ivory and forest green scheme rather than introducing unrelated colors.
I expect navigation between registration, login, tool lists, and tool details to be accessible via obvious UI elements that follow the established color scheme.

URL: As a user, I want to register an account so that I can use the website’s functionality.
As a user, I want to log in so that I can access my personal features on the website.
As a user, I want to view information about various tools so that I can learn about the tools available.
As a user, I want to see each tool’s name so that I can identify the tool.
As a user, I want to see each tool’s description so that I can understand what the tool is.
As a user, I want to see each tool’s function so that I know what the tool is used for.
As a user, I want to see each tool’s price so that I can understand the cost of the tool.
As a user, I want to search for tools so that I can quickly find specific tools I am interested in.
As a user, I want to filter tools so that I can narrow down the tool list based on my criteria.
As a user, I want to view detailed tool information so that I can thoroughly evaluate a tool.
As a user, I want to comment on tools so that I can share my feedback and experiences.
As a user, I want to rate tools so that I can express my level of satisfaction with them.
As a user, I want the website to use ivory as the global background color so that the overall background is consistent.
As a user, I want all UI pieces to use forest green so that the interface elements have a consistent color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a website that provides tool information for engineers. The website should have user registration and login functionality, and be able to display information about various tools, including tool name, description, function, price, etc. Users should be able to search and filter tools, view detailed tool information, and be able to comment and rate tools. Declare ivory as the global background color and forest green for all UI pieces.

name: Online Calculation Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me easily perform and review mathematical calculations.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to enter mathematical expressions in a single, continuous input field rather than specifying each operand and operator in separate fields.
I expect the system to recognize standard mathematical notation such as +, -, *, /, parentheses, and exponents in my expressions.
I expect the system to handle individual mathematical expressions one at a time rather than requiring me to define a batch of expressions before calculating.
I expect that each calculation type I select is applied only to the current mathematical expression I am working on.
I expect the calculation results to be presented as explicit numerical values rather than as unresolved symbolic expressions.
I expect the system to show both the original mathematical expression and its result together when I review a computation.
I expect to confirm or trigger the execution of a calculation with a single, explicit action such as pressing a button or hitting the Enter key.
I expect to choose the calculation type before executing the calculation so that the system does not automatically guess which type to apply.
I expect that changing the calculation type will not immediately compute a result until I explicitly execute the calculation.
I expect the mint cream background color to be applied consistently across the main screen area where I perform and review calculations.
I expect teal highlights to be applied to interactive components such as buttons, selected options, or focused fields rather than to all text or backgrounds.
I expect the teal highlight color to be visually distinct from the mint cream background so that highlighted components are easy to notice.

URL: As a user, I want to input mathematical expressions so that I can specify the calculations I need to perform.
As a user, I want to select the calculation type so that I can choose how my mathematical expressions are processed.
As a user, I want to execute the calculation so that I can obtain the computed results of my mathematical expressions.
As a user, I want to view the calculation results so that I can see the outcome of my computations.
As a user, I want the screen background to use mint cream so that the website has the specified visual appearance.
As a user, I want component highlights to use teal so that key interface elements are visually distinguished as specified.
instruction: Please implement a computing task website for performing calculations. The website should have functionalities for inputting mathematical expressions, executing calculations, and displaying results. Users should be able to input mathematical expressions, select the calculation type (e.g., "Basic Arithmetic"), execute the calculation, and view the calculation results. Use mint cream as the screen background and teal for component highlights.

name: Online Diagram Maker
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me easily create and customize different kinds of diagrams.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify and select diagram elements from a predefined palette or library of shapes rather than defining new shapes from scratch.
I expect to select existing diagrams to edit by choosing them from a list or gallery of previously created diagrams.
I assume the system will support multiple distinct diagrams within the same workspace or account so I can manage several diagrams separately.
I expect each diagram to allow a sufficient number of elements so that even complex ideas can be represented without running into arbitrary limits.
I expect each diagram element to have editable textual labels so that I can describe what each element represents.
I expect diagrams to support connectors or links between elements for representing relationships or flows where relevant.
I expect each diagram type (flowchart, organizational chart, mind map) to offer element shapes and structures that are typical for that diagram type.
I expect that when I adjust the style of my diagrams I can change basic visual properties such as line thickness, colors, and fonts for elements.
I prefer to create new diagrams through an explicit creation action, such as clicking a button or menu option, rather than the system creating diagrams implicitly.
I prefer to add or remove diagram elements with simple direct actions like clicking or dragging rather than through multi-step configuration dialogs.
I expect drag-and-drop interactions to provide immediate visual feedback while I move elements so I can see the resulting layout in real time.
I expect that when I adjust the layout of a diagram, elements will stay where I place them until I intentionally move them again.
I assume I can select multiple elements at once to move or adjust them together when organizing the layout.
I expect each diagram type I choose to have its own default layout and style configuration appropriate to that type.
I expect the ghost white background color to apply uniformly across the entire editable canvas area of the diagram.
I expect slate gray component details to contrast clearly with the ghost white background so that text and element outlines are easy to read.
I expect the visual style of elements to remain consistent across all diagrams unless I explicitly change style settings.
I assume the diagram view will fit on the screen with the ability to pan or zoom so I can see both the overall structure and detailed elements clearly.

URL: As a user, I want to create new diagrams so that I can start visualizing my ideas from scratch.
As a user, I want to edit existing diagrams so that I can update and refine my previous work.
As a user, I want to add diagram elements so that I can expand and detail my diagrams.
As a user, I want to remove diagram elements so that I can eliminate unnecessary or incorrect parts.
As a user, I want to adjust the layout of my diagrams so that I can organize elements clearly.
As a user, I want to adjust the style of my diagrams so that I can control their visual appearance.
As a user, I want to choose from different diagram types so that I can create diagrams suited to my specific needs.
As a user, I want to create flowcharts so that I can represent processes step by step.
As a user, I want to create organizational charts so that I can visualize hierarchical structures.
As a user, I want to create mind maps so that I can brainstorm and organize ideas visually.
As a user, I want to use a drag-and-drop interface to add diagram elements so that I can build diagrams easily.
As a user, I want to use a drag-and-drop interface to arrange diagram elements so that I can position components intuitively.
As a user, I want the diagram layout background to be ghost white so that the workspace has a consistent, modern look.
As a user, I want component details to be displayed in slate gray so that the diagram elements have a clear and consistent visual style.
instruction: Please implement a modern diagram maker website for creating and editing diagrams. The website should have functionalities for creating new diagrams, editing existing diagrams, adding and removing diagram elements, and adjusting layout and style. Users should be able to choose from different diagram types, such as flowcharts, organizational charts, and mind maps, and use a drag-and-drop interface to add and arrange diagram elements. Select ghost white for layout background and slate gray for component details.

name: Smart To-Do Manager
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me organize and keep track of my tasks.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I consider a to-do item and a task to be the same type of object, so I expect to manage them through a single, unified list.
I expect to uniquely identify a task by a short textual title or name when creating, editing, searching, or filtering.
I want the system to support an arbitrarily growing number of tasks in my to-do list without requiring me to archive or split lists manually.
I expect that when I delete a task it is removed from all views where it might appear, so I no longer see it anywhere in the system.
I want each task to store at least a title and a description so that editing a task allows me to change both its name and its details.
I expect each task to have a completion status that can be updated without changing the rest of the task information.
I want the system to distinguish between tasks that are pending and tasks that are completed based on an explicit status field, not by removing completed tasks.
I expect to be able to create, edit, delete, filter, search, browse, and mark completion of tasks directly from the application’s user interface without needing separate tools.
I want marking a task as completed to be a quick, low-effort action that does not require re-entering other task details.
I expect filtering and searching tasks to operate over the same underlying list that I use for browsing all to-do items.
I want filtering to narrow down the currently visible tasks based on attributes like completion status or text content, rather than taking me to a completely different section of the app.
I expect searching tasks to be text-based so that entering keywords will match relevant task titles or descriptions.
I want browsing all to-do items to include both completed and pending tasks unless I actively filter them out.
I expect the lavender background color to be applied consistently across every screen or page of the application, not only on the main task view.
I want interactive interface elements such as buttons, input fields, and task cards to use an indigo color so that they visually contrast with the lavender background.
I expect the indigo components to be used consistently for similar types of interface elements across the application.
I want the visual distinction between background and components to make it easy to see which parts of the interface are interactive.

URL: As a user, I want to create new to-do items so that I can keep track of tasks I need to complete.
As a user, I want to edit existing to-do items so that I can update task details when they change.
As a user, I want to delete to-do items so that I can remove tasks that are no longer needed.
As a user, I want to add new tasks so that I can expand my to-do list as new responsibilities arise.
As a user, I want to mark tasks as completed so that I can distinguish finished work from pending items.
As a user, I want to delete tasks so that I can clean up tasks that are unnecessary.
As a user, I want to filter tasks so that I can focus on a specific subset of my to-do items.
As a user, I want to search tasks so that I can quickly find specific to-do items.
As a user, I want to browse all to-do items so that I can view my entire list of tasks.
As a user, I want all pages to have a lavender background so that the application has a consistent visual style.
As a user, I want the components to be indigo so that the interface elements visually stand out against the background.
instruction: Please implement an advanced to-do list web application where users can create, edit, and delete to-do items. The application should have functionalities for adding new tasks, marking tasks as completed, deleting tasks, filtering tasks, and searching tasks. Users should be able to browse all to-do items, create new tasks, edit existing tasks, and delete unnecessary tasks. Set all pages to have a lavender background and indigo components.

name: Cross-Platform HTML Editor
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me easily create and manage HTML content across different platforms.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want the same HTML editing projects to be openable and editable on all operating systems I use without needing different project formats per platform.
I want to be able to select which project I am working on so that the editor clearly separates files and settings per project.
I want switching between different operating systems to require no additional conversion steps for my HTML files and projects.
I expect changes in the HTML editor to be reflected in the live preview automatically without requiring me to trigger manual refresh actions.
I want the live preview to render HTML in a way that is visually close to how it will appear in a typical web browser.
I expect the code editing area to behave like a typical text editor with familiar keyboard shortcuts for editing operations.
I want the code editing mode to allow me to see and modify all underlying HTML tags and attributes without hidden transformations.
I want to be able to switch between HTML code mode and text mode at any time while editing the same document.
I expect the HTML code and text editing modes to represent the same document content so that switching modes does not lose information.
I want the editor to infer appropriate HTML structure from my typed text when converting to HTML, such as paragraphs or basic formatting.
I expect automatic text-to-HTML conversion to occur with minimal additional steps, such as happening on demand or as I apply formatting.
I want a project to include multiple related HTML documents and associated assets under a single project container.
I want to be able to specify which files belong to a particular project when creating or modifying that project.
I expect the project management capabilities to track file locations and names so I do not have to remember all paths manually.
I want to be able to maintain several HTML documents within one project to represent different pages of the same site or application.
I want to open and switch between multiple HTML documents within the editor without leaving the project context.
I expect the organization of HTML documents to support logical grouping, such as by folders or similar structural mechanisms.
I want to store images and other asset files in the same project space that holds my HTML documents.
I want to be able to add new image and asset files to a project by selecting them from my file system.
I expect the editor to keep track of which images and other files belong to each project so they can be easily reused in HTML documents.
I want HTML syntax highlighting to visually distinguish elements such as tags, attributes, and text content using different colors or styles.
I expect syntax highlighting to update immediately as I type or edit HTML code.
I want template pages to store both HTML structure and any default content that I commonly reuse.
I want to be able to create a new HTML document from a saved template with a simple selection action.
I expect to be able to maintain multiple different template pages for different kinds of layouts.
I want the basic user guide to cover the main tasks I need, such as creating projects, editing HTML, managing files, and using templates.
I want the user guide to be easily accessible from within the editor interface without requiring an external document search.
I expect the user guide to be navigable so that I can quickly find instructions for specific features.
I want the honeydew background color to apply consistently across the primary editor workspace to maintain a uniform look.
I expect the honeydew background to remain the same across all supported platforms so that the interface looks consistent.
I want the dark olive green component color to be used for key interface elements such as buttons, panels, or menus to follow the chosen color scheme.
I expect the combination of honeydew background and dark olive green components to provide sufficient visual contrast while preserving the specified palette.

URL: As a user, I want to use a cross-platform HTML editor so that I can work on my projects across different operating systems.
As a user, I want live preview functionality so that I can immediately see how my HTML code will render.
As a user, I want code editing functionality so that I can write and modify HTML code directly.
As a user, I want to switch between HTML code and text editing modes so that I can choose the editing mode that best suits my task.
As a user, I want the editor to automatically convert text to HTML so that I do not need to manually write all the markup.
As a user, I want project management capabilities so that I can manage related files within a single project.
As a user, I want to organize multiple HTML documents so that I can structure my project content efficiently.
As a user, I want to organize images and other files so that all project assets are kept together in the editor.
As a user, I want syntax highlighting so that I can more easily read and debug my HTML code.
As a user, I want to save template pages so that I can reuse common layouts or structures in future projects.
As a user, I want access to a basic user guide so that I can learn how to use the editor’s features.
As a user, I want the background color set to honeydew so that the editor interface is visually consistent as specified.
As a user, I want the component color set to dark olive green so that the editor components follow the required color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a cross-platform HTML editor with live preview and code editing functionality. The editor should allow users to switch between HTML code and text editing modes and automatically convert to HTML. The editor should have project management capabilities, allowing users to organize multiple HTML documents, images, and other files. The editor should also have features such as syntax highlighting, saving template pages, and a basic user guide. Set the background color to honeydew and the component color to dark olive green.

name: Food Distribution Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to help coordinate food donations and distributions in my community.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect food donations to be identified with basic details such as type of food, quantity, and availability timeframe when I browse donation information.
I want applicants for food distribution to identify themselves with sufficient personal details for eligibility and contact purposes when they apply.
I expect volunteers to be identified with role-related information such as their name, role, and participation status in the volunteer information section.
I want the system to serve all three groups—donors, recipients, and volunteers—within a single integrated website rather than separate tools.
I expect the food donation and distribution functions to cover both current and upcoming opportunities, not just historical records.
I want the volunteer information to cover both individual volunteers and any organized groups involved in the efforts.
I want food donation listings to include enough detail for me to judge suitability, such as food category and any special notes or conditions.
I expect the food distribution application to capture my specific needs, such as household size or type of food required, instead of just a generic request.
I want volunteer information to show at least basic descriptions of volunteer roles or responsibilities, not just names.
I expect my account management area to include personal contact details and notification or communication preferences.
I want to browse food donations without needing to complete complex steps so I can quickly see what is available.
I expect applying for food distribution to be a guided process with clear fields and steps rather than a free-form request.
I want to be able to update my account details directly on the website without needing to contact an administrator.
I expect the volunteer management functionality to allow coordinators and volunteers to interact through the same website interface rather than external tools.
I want the main donation, distribution, and volunteer-related features to be accessible via straightforward navigation from the home page.
I expect all main pages of the website to share the same azure background to maintain a uniform look across the site.
I want primary interface elements such as headers, buttons, and menus to consistently use the midnight blue color to distinguish them from the background.
I expect the azure background and midnight blue components to be used together in a way that clearly separates interactive elements from static content.
I want the visual style using azure and midnight blue to apply equally to the donation, distribution, volunteer, and account pages for consistency.

URL: As a user, I want to browse food donation information so that I can see what food is available for donation.
As a user, I want to apply for food distribution so that I can receive the food I need.
As a user, I want to view volunteer information so that I can understand who is involved in the food distribution efforts.
As a user, I want to manage my own account so that I can keep my personal information and preferences up to date.
As a user, I want the website to support food donation functionality so that food can be contributed for distribution.
As a user, I want the website to support food distribution functionality so that donated food can be effectively distributed.
