As a user, I want the website to support volunteer management functionality so that volunteers can be organized and coordinated.
As a user, I want the website to use an azure background so that the interface has a consistent visual style.
As a user, I want the website components to use midnight blue so that the elements are visually distinct and cohesive.
instruction: Please implement a food distribution website for managing and distributing food. The website should have functionalities for food donation, food distribution, and volunteer management. Users should be able to browse food donation information, apply for food distribution, view volunteer information, and manage their own accounts. Use azure for the background and midnight blue for components.

name: Detective Case Manager
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me manage investigation cases and keep track of the work done on them.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each investigation case will have a unique identifier that I can use to locate and distinguish it from other cases.
I expect to be able to find a case either by browsing a list of cases or by searching with key attributes such as case name, client, or case ID.
I want the system to manage only detective agency investigation cases and not other types of business records.
I expect the system to track both active and past cases so that I can review work done on completed investigations.
I expect case information to include core details such as client information, case description, status, and key dates.
I expect real-time reports to be associated with a specific case so that updates are clearly tied to the correct investigation.
I want each real-time report to capture essential fields such as date and time, author, case reference, and a narrative description of the findings.
I expect submitting a real-time report to be possible directly from the case view without navigating through multiple separate screens.
I assume the system will maintain a chronological history of submitted reports for each case.
I expect the data collected and stored for each case to include reports, work hour logs, and expense-related information in a single place.
I want logging work hours to be done per case and per user so that individual contributions can be distinguished.
I expect each work hour entry to include at least the date, time span, user, and a brief description of the activity performed.
I assume the system will aggregate work hour entries per case to show total time spent on that case.
I expect estimated expense sheets to be linked to a specific case and to list projected cost items such as labor, travel, and materials.
I assume the system will use a consistent template for all estimated expense sheets so that they follow the same structure across cases.
I want to be able to open an estimated expense sheet directly from the related case’s overview.
I expect a service assignment sheet to list which staff or resources are assigned to specific tasks within a case.
I assume each case can have one or more service assignments documented in the system.
I want to view service assignment sheets from within the case details so that I do not have to navigate to a separate module.
I expect the beige background color to be applied consistently across all primary screens of the app.
I want saddle brown styling to be used for major interface components such as headers, buttons, and navigation elements.
I assume text, icons, and controls will be legible against the beige background and saddle brown components without additional color variations.
I expect the beige and saddle brown color scheme to be applied to new features and screens added in the future for visual consistency.
I expect navigation between case browsing, reporting, time logging, and sheet viewing to be integrated within a single coherent application interface.

URL: As a user, I want to browse case information so that I can view details of detective agency cases.
As a user, I want to submit real-time reports so that I can provide up-to-date information on cases.
As a user, I want the app to support real-time reporting so that case updates are captured immediately.
As a user, I want the app to collect and store data so that case information is safely maintained for future reference.
As a user, I want to log work hours so that I can track the time spent on each case.
As a user, I want the app to track work hours so that overall time spent on cases is accurately recorded.
As a user, I want to view estimated expense sheets so that I can understand the projected costs related to a case.
As a user, I want the app to generate estimated expense sheets so that expense estimates are created consistently.
As a user, I want to view service assignment sheets so that I can see how services are allocated for a case.
As a user, I want the app to provide a service assignment sheet so that service assignments are clearly documented.
As a user, I want the app to use beige as the background so that the interface matches the specified design.
As a user, I want all components styled with saddle brown so that the app has a consistent visual theme.
instruction: Please implement a detective agency case management app for managing cases and tracking work hours. The app should have functionalities for real-time reporting, data collection and storage, work hours tracking, estimated expense sheet generation, and service assignment sheet. Users should be able to browse case information, submit real-time reports, log work hours, and view estimated expense sheets and service assignment sheets. Apply beige as the background; style all components with saddle brown.

name: Risk Assessment Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me assess risks and obtain clear risk assessment reports.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify which risk assessment I am working on by selecting it from options presented on the website rather than entering all information manually from scratch.
I assume the system will let me choose relevant risk assessment items from a predefined catalog or list rather than requiring me to define every item myself.
I expect the website to recognize which data fields can be filled from the background database without requiring me to specify each field individually.
I want the risk assessments to cover multiple risk factors within a single assessment session so that I can evaluate a complete scenario at once.
I assume the system will allow me to include only the selected risk items in a particular assessment, excluding all non‑relevant items from that run.
I expect the auto-populated data to cover all commonly needed fields for a typical risk assessment, not just a minimal subset.
I expect the background database to contain standard reference data needed for risk assessments, such as predefined risk factors, categories, or baseline values.
I want the auto-populated fields to be based on accurate, up-to-date information from the background database rather than static placeholder values.
I expect the generated charts to reflect the numerical or categorical outcomes of the risk assessment rather than decorative or unrelated data.
I want the charts to include all assessed risk items that are part of the current assessment so that no selected item is omitted from the visualizations.
I expect generated reports to include both the input risk items and their corresponding assessment results, not just one or the other.
I want the risk assessment reports to include enough detail for others to understand how the risk levels were determined without needing to access the tool directly.
I assume my subscription status will determine which risk assessment features and content I can access on the website.
I want to initiate and complete risk assessments directly through interactive pages on the website without needing separate tools or manual forms.
I expect to be able to select and deselect risk assessment items using common web controls such as checkboxes, lists, or dropdowns.
I want automatic data filling from the background database to occur in response to my selections or inputs without requiring extra steps like separate import actions.
I expect the subscription feature to require me to log in or otherwise identify myself before using the risk assessment tool.
I want the process of creating reports and charts to be triggered by simple actions such as clicking buttons after I finish an assessment.
I expect charts to be displayed directly within the website interface rather than only being available as file downloads.
I want the generated reports to be presented in a structured, readable format that clearly separates different sections of the assessment.
I assume that the alice blue background color will apply uniformly across all website pages related to risk assessment.
I expect the steel blue component color to be consistently applied to interactive elements such as buttons, menus, and form controls.
I want charts and reports to visually match the website’s alice blue background and steel blue component color so that the interface looks cohesive.

URL: As a user, I want to conduct risk assessments on the website so that I can evaluate risks systematically.
As a user, I want to select risk assessment items so that I can focus the assessment on relevant risk factors.
As a user, I want the website to automatically fill in relevant data from a background database so that I can save time and reduce manual data entry.
As a user, I want the website to auto-populate data so that the risk assessment process is more efficient.
As a user, I want the website to generate charts so that I can visualize the risk assessment results.
As a user, I want the website to create reports so that I can document and share the risk assessment outcomes.
As a user, I want the website to generate risk assessment reports so that I can have a comprehensive record of the assessed risks.
As a user, I want a subscription feature so that I can access the risk assessment tool.
As a user, I want the website background defined as alice blue so that the interface has a consistent background color.
As a user, I want the website components defined as steel blue so that the interface elements have a consistent component color.
instruction: Please implement a risk assessment website for conducting risk assessments and generating reports. The website should have functionalities for selecting risk assessment items, auto-populating data, generating charts, and creating reports. Users should be able to select risk assessment items, and the website will automatically fill in relevant data from a background database, generate charts, and create reports. The website should also have a subscription feature, allowing users to access the risk assessment tool. Define the background as alice blue and components as steel blue.
